page.title: 13RECREATION ON THE CANAL
page.content: The Bridgwater and Taunton Canal is already quite well used for recreational purposes. The British Waterways Board owns the fishing rights and they license them to the Bridgwater Angling Association and the Taunton Angling Association. The closed season is from March to June.The main types of fish in the canal are tench,roach,eels,pike and carp.We saw men and boys fishing and they had all made good catches. At the moment there is only the very occasional canoe or rowing boat on the canal.The plan is to make the canal more suitable for boating. The towpath is a public right of way and local people enjoy walking their dogs here.It has also been used for sponsored walks.Along the path there is one bench and this has been put up as a memorial.
